categories.title: Player Actions
categories.definition: Events directly initiated by player's interaction with the game.
categories.focus: Capturing and responding to inputs from the player within the game environment.
categories.example: "Player Collects Item" - Triggered when a player picks up an item.

categories.title: Game Responses
categories.definition: The system's reactions to player actions or other game events.
categories.focus: Providing feedback or consequences for player actions or specific game conditions.
categories.example: "Game Over" - Occurs when the player's health reaches zero, ending the game.

categories.title: Entities
categories.definition: Objects in the game that have their own properties, behaviors, and states.
categories.focus: The characteristics and interactions of in-game elements.
categories.example: "Item Unlocks Door" - An item changes the state of a door entity from locked to unlocked.

categories.title: Information Display
categories.definition: Events related to presenting information to the player via the UI.
categories.focus: Communicating game states, objectives, and relevant information effectively.
categories.example: "Score Update" - Reflects new scores on the game UI after achieving certain milestones.

categories.title: Game Progression
categories.definition: Events that advance the game's narrative or level structure.
categories.focus: Structuring the sequence of events for guiding player experience.
categories.example: "Level Completed" - Signifies the completion of a level's objectives, allowing progression.

categories.title: Game Logic
categories.definition: The core mechanics and rules governing the game.
categories.focus: Implementing the foundational principles for game behavior and interactions.
categories.example: "Calculate the shortest path?" - Uses algorithms to determine navigable paths for AI or puzzles.
